title: Spare Parts Consumption Anomaly Detection
subtitle: Detecting abnormal spare parts usage to prevent downtime and optimize maintenance

sections.overview: This project detects anomalies in item consumption based on historical dispatch data from an industrial warehouse. It integrates data wrangling, time series analysis, seasonality detection, and anomaly detection techniques to identify unusual dispatch behavior for specific inventory items. The system supports proactive maintenance and stock control by highlighting abnormal consumption patterns before they escalate into critical failures.
businessValue: Early detection of equipment failures and material misuse
Reduction of unnecessary stock usage and procurement costs
Improved maintenance planning and downtime prevention
keyResults: Generated **USD 58K in savings** from prevented consumption
benefits: Item-level anomaly detection with statistical rigor
Scalable across assets, equipment types, and locations
Enables proactive maintenance actions and inventory control
